medical_history.chief_complaint: Gradual cognitive decline and behavioral changes associated with Fabry disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient initially presented with pain in the distal extremities in childhood. At age 20, routine health check-up revealed left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) and proteinuria. Definitive diagnosis of classical Fabry disease (FD) at age 37. ERT initiated at age 38. At age 42, he experienced cerebral infarction, followed by additional brain infarctions at age 48, resulting in numbness on the left side of the body and cognitive impairments. Over the next three years, displayed perplexed utterance and behavior, and became reclusive, culminating in the need for nursing care at age 51.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Classical Fabry disease, left ventricular hypertrophy, proteinuria, multiple cerebral infarctions, end-stage renal failure.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a family history of Fabry disease; grandmother died due to stroke and heart disease, mother and brother diagnosed with FD.
medical_history.social_history: Previous employment termination due to cognitive and behavioral issues; began using short-term residential care. No specific mention of smoking or alcohol use.
